text: made manifest? And who has understood her great experience? There is One wise and greatly to be revered:
HWHY sitting upon His throne. He created her, and saw her, and measured her,
And poured her out upon all His works. She is with all flesh according to His gift,
And He has given her to those who love Him. The reverence of HWHY is esteem and splendour
and gladness, And a crown of rejoicing. The reverence of HWHY makes a glad heart,
And gives joy, and gladness, and a long life. It shall go well to the end for he who reveres
HWHY, And he shall find favour in the day of his death. To revere HWHY is the beginning of wisdom:
And it was created with the trustworthy in the womb. She has built an everlasting foundation with men,
And she shall continue with their seed. 1109
And fills men with her fruits. She fills all their house with that which is
desirable, And the gatherers with her increase. The reverence of HWHY is a crown of wisdom,
Making peace and perfect health to flourish; Both of which are gifts of Elohim; And it increases the rejoicing of those that love Him. Wisdom rains down skill and knowledge of
understanding, And exalts to esteem those who hold her fast. The root of wisdom is to revere HWHY,
And the branches thereof are long life. The reverence of HWHY drives away sins,
And where it is present, it turns away wrath. A wrathful man cannot be declared right;
For the sway of his wrath shall be his destruction. A patient man shall weep for a time,
And afterward joy shall spring up in him. He shall hold his words for a time,
And the lips of many shall declare his wisdom. The parables of knowledge are in the treasures of
wisdom: But reverence is an abomination to a sinner. If you desire wisdom, guard the Commands,
And HWHY shall give her to you. For the reverence of HWHY is wisdom and
instruction; And belief and meekness are his delight. Do not doubt the reverence of HWHY when you are
poor: And do not come to him with a double mind. Do not be a hypocrite in the sight of men,
And take heed what you speak. Do not exalt yourself, lest you fall, and bring
shame upon yourself, 1110
My son, if you come to serve HWHY, Prepare your being for trial. Prepare your heart, and constantly endure,
And do not hasten in time of trouble. Cling to Him, and do not depart,
That you may be increased at your latter end. Whatsoever is brought upon you, accept
cheerfully, And be patient when you are brought low. For gold is tried in the fire,
And acceptable men in the furnace of adversity. Believe in Him, and He shall help you;
Establish your way, and trust in Him. You who revere HWHY, wait for His kindness;
And do not turn aside, lest you fall. You who revere HWHY, believe Him;
And your reward shall not fail. You who revere HWHY, have expectancy for good,
And for everlasting joy and kindness. Look at the generations of old and see;

Did any ever trust in HWHY, and were put to shame? Or did any remain in His reverence, and were forsaken? Or whom did He ever despise, that called upon Him? For HWHY is full of compassion and kindness,
Patient, and very tender-hearted, and forgives sins, And saves in time of affliction. Woe unto fearful hearts, and faint hands,
And the sinner that goes two ways! 1111
For he is unbelieving; Therefore he shall not be defended. Woe unto you that have lost patience!
And what shall you do when HWHY shall punish you? Those who HWHY shall not disobey His Word;
And those who love Him guard His Ways. Those who revere HWHY seek that which is well-
pleasing to Him; And those who love Him shall be filled with the Torah. Those who revere prepare HWHY their hearts,
And humble their beings in His sight, Saying, “We shall fall into the hands of HWHY, and
not into the hands of men; For as His excellence is, so is His kindness.”
Hear me your father, O children, and do accordingly, that you may be safe. For HWHY has given the father esteem over the
children, And has confirmed the authority of the mother over the sons. Whoever esteems his father makes an atonement
for his sins; And he who esteems his mother is as one who
stores up treasure. Whoever esteems his father shall have joy from
his own children; And when he makes his prayer, he shall be heard. He who esteems his father shall have a long life;
And he who is obedient to HWHY shall be a comfort to his mother. He who reveres HWHY shall esteem his father,
And shall do service unto his parents, as to his masters. 1112
deed, That a beraḵah may come upon you from them. For the beraḵah of the father establishes the
houses of children; But the curse of the mother roots out foundations. Do not rejoice in the shame of your father;
For your father’s shame is no esteem unto you. For the esteem of a man is from the esteem of his
father; And a mother in shame is a reproach to the children. My son, help your father in his age,
And do not grieve him as long as he lives. And if his understanding fails, have patience with
him; And do not despise him when you are in your full strength. For the relief for your father shall not be forgotten;
And instead of sin, it shall be added to build you up. In the day of your affliction it shall be
remembered; Your sins also shall melt away, as the ice in the fair warm weather. He who forsakes his father is as a blasphemer;
And he who displeases his mother is cursed of Elohim. My son, go on with your business in meekness;
So you shall be beloved of He who approves. The greater you are, the more you humble
yourself, And you shall find favour before HWHY. Many are in high places, and of name;
But mysteries are revealed to the meek. For the power of HWHY is great,
And He is esteemed by the lowly. Do not search out that which is too hard for you,
Neither seek that which is above your strength. 1113
reverence, For it is not necessary for you to see with your eyes that which is secret. Do not be curious in unnecessary matters:
For more is revealed to you than men understand. For many are deceived by their own worthless
opinion; And evil suspicion has overthrown their judgment. Without eyes there is no light;
Do not profess the knowledge which you do not have. A stubborn heart shall suffer evil in the end;
And he who loves danger shall perish in it. A hard heart shall be loaded with sorrows;
And the wicked man shall heap sin upon sin. In the punishment of the proud there is no
remedy; For the plant of wickedness has taken root in him. The heart of the clever shall understand a parable;
And an attentive ear is the desire of a wise man. Water shall quench a flaming fire;
And kind deeds make an atonement for sins. And he who repays good deeds remembers that
which may come after; And when he falls, he shall find a support.
My son, do not rob the poor of his living, And do not allow the needy eyes to wait long. Do not make a hungry being sorrowful;
Neither provoke a man in his distress. Do not add more trouble to a heart that is tortured;
And do not delay to give to he who is in need. Do not reject the supplication of the afflicted;
Neither turn away your face from a poor man. Do not turn away your eye from the needy,
And give him no occasion to curse you; 1114
His prayer shall be heard by He who made him. Earn for yourself the love of the assembly,
And bow your head to a great man. Let it not grieve you to bend your ear to the poor,
And give him a friendly answer with meekness. Deliver he who suffers wrong from the hand of the
oppressor; And do not be faint-hearted when you sit in judgment. Be as a father to the fatherless,
And like a husband to their mother; So you shall be as the Ben of the Most High, And He shall love you more than your mother does. Wisdom exalts her children,
And lays hold of those who seek her. He who loves her loves ḥai;
And those who seek her early shall be filled with joy. He who holds her fast shall inherit esteem;
And wherever she enters, HWHY shall baraḵ. Those who serve her serve the Qadosh One:
And those who love her HWHY loves. Whoever gives ear to her shall judge the nations:
And he who attends to her shall dwell securely. If a man commits himself to her, he shall inherit
her; And his generation shall hold her in possession. For at first she shall walk by him in crooked ways,
And bring fear and dread upon him, And punish him with her discipline, Until she may trust his being, and try him by her laws. Then she shall return him to the straight way,
And comfort him, and show him her secrets. But if he goes wrong, she shall forsake him,
And give him over to his own ruin. Watch for opportunity, and beware of evil;
And do not be ashamed when it concerns your being. 1115
And there is shame which is esteem and favour. Do not show partiality against your being,
And do not let the fear of any man cause you to fall. And do not refrain to speak, when there is
occasion to do good, And do not hide your wisdom in her loveliness. For by speech wisdom shall be known;
And learning by the word of the tongue.
But be ashamed of the straying of your ignorance. Do not be ashamed to confess your sins;
And do not force the course of the river. Do not make yourself a servant to a foolish man;
Neither show partiality to the mighty.
And HWHY shall fight for you. Do not be hasty with your tongue,
Or slack and negligent in your deeds. Do not be as a lion in your house,
Nor wroth among your servants. Do not let your hand be stretched out to receive,
And closed when you should repay.
Do not lay your heart upon your goods; And do not say, “I have enough for my life.” Do not follow your own mind and strength,
To walk in the ways of your heart: And do not say, “Who shall control me in my
deeds?” For HWHY shall surely punish your pride. Do not say, “I have sinned, and what harm has
befallen me? For HWHY is patient, He shall by no means let you go. Concerning atonement,
Do not be without reverence to add sin unto sin; 1116
He shall be appeased for the multitude of my sins.” For kindness and wrath come from Him, And His wrath rests upon sinners. Do not delay to turn to HWHY, and do not put off
from day to day; For suddenly the wrath of HWHY shall come forth, And in your security you shall be destroyed, And perish in the day of vengeance. Do not lay your heart upon goods acquired
unrighteously, For they shall not profit you in the day of calamity. Do not winnow with every wind, and do not go into
every way: For so does the sinner that has a double tongue. Be steadfast in your understanding;
And let your word be the same. Be swift to hear; and let your being be sincere;
And give answer with patience. If you have understanding, answer your
neighbour; If not, put your hand over your mouth. Esteem and shame is in speech;
And the tongue of man is his downfall. Do not be a whisperer, and do not lie in wait with
your tongue; For foul shame is upon the thief, and an evil condemnation upon the double- tongued. Do not be ignorant of any matter, great or a small.
Do not become an enemy instead of a friend; For you shall inherit an evil name, shame, and reproach; Even as a sinner that has a double tongue. Do not exalt yourself in the counsel of your own
heart; That your being be not torn in pieces as a bull. 1117
fruit, And leave yourself as a dry tree. A wicked being shall destroy he who possesses,
And shall cause him to be laughed to scorn by his enemies. Sweet words shall multiply friends,
And a favourable tongue shall increase kind greetings. Be at peace with many;
But have just one counsellor in a thousand. If you would get a friend, prove him first and do
not be hasty to trust him. For a certain man is a friend for his own occasion,
And shall not remain in the day of your trouble. And there is a friend, who being turned to enmity,
shall cause strife and uncover your reproach. Again, there is a friend, a companion at the table,
But shall not continue in the day of your affliction. When you are prosperous he shall be as you are,
And shall be bold over your servants. If you are brought low, he shall be against you,
And shall hide himself from your face. Separate yourself from your enemies,
And be on guard with your friends. A trustworthy friend is a strong defence;
And he who has found such a one has found a treasure. There is none that makes up for a trustworthy
friend, And his worth is invaluable. A trustworthy friend is the healing of life;
And those who revere HWHY shall find Him. Whoever reveres HWHY directs his friendship well;
For as he is, so shall his neighbour be also. 1118
onward; So you shall gain wisdom till your old age. Come to her as one that plows and sows, and wait
for her good fruit; For you shall not toil much in labouring over her, But you shall eat of her fruit soon enough. She is very unpleasant to the unlearned;
He who is without understanding shall not remain with her. She shall lay upon him as a mighty stone of trial;
And he shall throw her from him before long. For wisdom is according to her name,
And she is not revealed to many. Listen my son, receive my advice,
And do not refuse my counsel, And put your feet into her shackles,
And your neck into her chain. Bow down your shoulder, and bear her,
And do not be grieved with her bonds. Come to her with your whole heart,
And guard her ways with all your strength. Search and seek, and she shall be made known
unto you; And when you have taken hold of her, do not let her go. For in the end you shall find her rest,
And that shall turn out for your joy. Then her shackles shall be a strong defence for
you, And her chains a robe of esteem. For there is a golden ornament upon her,
And her bands are purple lace. You shall put her on as a robe of esteem,
And shall lay her upon you as a crown of joy. My son, if you allow, you shall be taught;
And if you apply your mind, you shall be clever. 1119
understanding; And if you bow your ear, you shall be wise, Stand in the group of the elders;
And cling to he who is wise. Be willing to hear every worthy discourse;
And do not let the parables of understanding escape you. And if you see a man of understanding,
Get yourself to him early, And let your feet wear out his doorstep. Let your mind be upon the Laws of HWHY,
And consider His Commands continually; He shall establish your heart, and give you the wisdom you desire.
Do no evil, so no harm shall come to you. Depart from the unrighteous, and evil shall turn
away from you. My son, do not sow upon the furrows of
unrighteousness, And you shall not reap them sevenfold. Do not seek superiority from HWHY, Neither of the
royal seat of esteem. Do not declare yourself right before HWHY;
And do not boast of your wisdom before the sovereign. Do not seek to be judge, being unable to remove
evil; Lest at any time you be partial to the mighty, A stumbling block in the way of your uprightness. Do not cause the crowd of a city to stumble,
And then you shall not be brought low among the people. Do not bind one sin upon another;
For not one shall go unpunished. 1120
of my offerings, And when I offer to the Most High Elohim, He shall accept it.” Do not be faint-hearted when you make your
prayer, And do not neglect to give in kindness. Mock no man in the bitterness of his being;
For there is One who humbles and exalts. Do not plan a lie against your brother;
Neither do likewise to your friend. Refuse to make any manner of lie;
For the way of this is not good. Do not use many words among a multitude of
elders, And do not make much babbling when you pray. Do not hate laborious work, neither work of the
land, Which the Most High has ordained. Do not number yourself among the crowd of
sinners, But remember that wrath shall not delay. Humble yourself greatly;
For the punishment of the wicked is fire and worms. Do not exchange a friend for goods by any
means; Neither a trustworthy brother for the gold of Ophir. Do not forsake a wise and good woman;
For her favour is above gold. When your servant works trustworthily, do not
mistreat him. Nor the hired man that gives himself completely for you. Let your being love a good servant, and do not
withhold his freedom. Do you have cattle? Keep an eye on them;
And if they are for your profit, keep them with you. 1121
And bow their neck from their youth. Do you have daughters?
Look after their body, And do not be too generous toward them. Give your daughter in marriage, and you shall
have performed a weighty matter; But give her to a man of understanding. Do you have a wife in mind?
Do not forsake her; And do not give yourself over to an easy woman. Esteem your father with your whole heart,
And do not forget the sorrows of your mother. Remember that you were brought forth by them;
And how would you repay them what they have done for you? Revere HWHY with all your being, and revere His
kohenim. Love He who made you with all your strength,
And do not forsake his servants. Revere HWHY, and honour the kohĕn;
And give him his portion, as it is Commanded you; The first-fruits, and the guilt offering, and the wave offering,
That your beraḵah may be perfected. A gift has favour in the sight of every living man;
And do not hold back for the dead. Do not fail to accompany those who weep,
And mourn with those who mourn. Do not be slow to visit the sick;
For that shall cause you to be loved. Whatever you take in hand, remember the end,
And you shall never do wrong. 1122
Do not strive with a mighty man lest you fall into his hands. Do not quarrel with a wealthy man, lest he
outweigh you; For gold has destroyed many, and twisted the hearts of sovereigns. Do not strive with a man that is a babbler,
And do not heap wood upon his fire. Do not jest with a rude man,
Lest your ancestors be shamed. Do not reproach a man that turns from sin,
But remember that we are all worthy of punishment. Do not shame a man in his old age;
For even some of us grow old. Do not rejoice over the death of your greatest
enemy, But remember that we all die. Do not despise the discourse of the wise,
For they also learned from their fathers, And from them you shall learn understanding, And to give answer as needed. Do not kindle the coals of a sinner,
Lest you be burned with the flame of his fire. Do not rise up at the presence of an insuiter,
Lest he lie in wait to entrap you in your words. Do not lend to he who is mightier than
yourself; For if you lend to him, count it but lost. Do not be guarantor above your ability;
For if you be guarantor, take care to pay it. 1123
For they shall judge for him according to his esteem. Do not travel on the way with one who is
headstrong, Lest he become burdensome to you; For he shall do according to his own desire, And you shall perish with him through his folly. Do not strive with a man of wrath,
And do not go with him to a lonely place; For bloodshed is naught in his sight, And where there is no help, he shall overthrow you. Do not counsel a fool;
For he does not heed advice. Do not speak secrets before a stranger;
For you do not know what he shall reveal. Do not open your heart to every man,
Lest he repay you craftily.
Do not be jealous over the wife of your bosom, And do not teach her an evil lesson against yourself. Do not give yourself to a woman to trample your
strength. Do not go into a whore, lest you fall into her
snares. Do not keep company with a flirtatious woman,
Lest you be taken by her attempts. Do not stare upon a maiden,
So you do not fall by that which is precious in her. Do not give yourself to whores,
So that you do not lose your inheritance. Do not look about in the streets of the city,
Neither wander in its lonely places. Turn your eye away from a good- looking woman,
And do not look upon another’s loveliness; For many have been deceived by the loveliness of a 1124
Nor sit down with her in your arms, And do not spend your silver with her on wine; Lest your heart incline toward her, And so, through your desire fall into destruction. Do not forsake an old friend;
For the new is not comparable to him. A new friend is like new wine; When it is old, you shall drink it with pleasure. Do not envy the esteem of a sinner;
For you do not know what his end shall be. Do not delight in that which the wicked have
pleasure in; But remember they shall not go unpunished to their grave. Keep far from the man who has power to kill;

So the fear of death shall not concern you. And if you encounter him, make no mistake, Lest he take away your life immediately. Remember that you walk in the midst of snares, And that you walk upon the walls of the city. When you draw near, reason with your neighbour,
And consult with the wise. Let your words be with the wise,
And all your talk in the Law of the Most High. And let righteous men eat and drink with you;
And let your esteem be in the reverence of HWHY. For the hand of the craftsman the work shall be
praised, And the wise ruler of the people for his words. A man of an evil tongue is dangerous in his city;
And he who is hasty with his words shall be hated.
A wise judge shall instruct his people; And the reign of a clever man is well ordered. 1125
officers; And what manner of man the ruler of the city is, Such are all those who dwell in it. An unwise sovereign destroys his people;
But through the insight of those who are in authority the city shall be inhabited. The power of the earth is in the hand HWHY,
And in due time He shall appoint it to One who is worthy. The prosperity of man is in the hand of Elohim;
And He shall lay His esteem upon the face of the scribe. Do not bear hatred against your neighbour for
every wrong; And do not act as an insulter at all. Pride is hateful before Elohim and man;
And against both, one commits wickedness. Because of unrighteous dealings, maltreatment,
and wealth gained by deceit, The rule is transferred from one people to another. How could earth and ashes be proud?
There is none more wicked than a covetous man; For such a one puts his own being up for sale; For while he lives he destroys his inner being. The physician ends a long disease;
And he who is a sovereign today shall die tomorrow. For when a man is dead,
He shall inherit insects, creatures and worms. The beginning of pride is when one departs from
Elohim, And his heart is turned away from his Maker. For pride is the beginning of sin,
And he who has it shall pour out abominations: And therefore HWHY brings upon them unknown calamity, And overthrows them completely. 1126
princes, And appointed the meek in their place. HWHY has plucked up the roots of the proud
nations, And planted the lowly in their place. HWHY overthrew the lands of the gentiles,
And destroyed them to the foundations of the earth. He took some of them away, and destroyed them,
And has caused their remembrance to cease from the earth. Pride was not made for man,
Nor violent wrath for those who are born of a woman. Those who revere HWHY are a continual seed,
And those who love Him an esteemed plant. Those who disregard the Law are a shameful seed; Those who transgress the Commands are a deceptive seed. Among brothers he who is chief is esteemed;
So are those who revere HWHY in His eyes. The reverence of HWHY goes before the obtaining
of authority; But stubbornness and pride is the loss of it. Whether he is wealthy, noble or poor,
Their esteem is the reverence of HWHY. It is not right to despise the poor who has
understanding; Neither is it proper to exalt a sinner.
esteemed; Yet there is none greater than he who reveres HWHY. Those who are free shall do service to the servant
that is wise; And he who has knowledge shall not grumble when he is instructed. Do not be overwise in doing your business;
And do not boast in the time of your distress. 1127
Than he who boasts and lacks bread. My son, esteem your being in meekness,
And give it respect according to its quality. Who shall declare right he who sins against his
own being? And who shall esteem he who shames his own life? The poor man is esteemed for his skill,
And the wealthy man is esteemed for his wealth. He who is esteemed in poverty, how much more
in wealth? And he who is ashamed in wealth, how much more in poverty?
Wisdom lifts up the head of he who is of low degree, And makes him to sit among great men. Do not commend a man for his good looks;
Neither despise a man for his outward appearance. The bee is little among those that fly;
But her fruit is the first of that which is sweet. Do not boast of your garments and clothes,
And do not exalt yourself in the day of esteem; For the works of HWHY are wondrous, And His works among men are hidden. Many sovereigns have sat down on the
ground; And one that was never considered has worn the crown. Many mighty men have been greatly shamed;
And those esteemed delivered into other men’s hands. Do not accuse before you have examined the
Neither interrupt men in the middle of speaking. 1128
concern you; And do not sit in judgment with sinners. My son, do not engage in many matters;
For if you strive greatly, you shall not be innocent; And if you pursue, you shall not obtain, Neither shall you escape by fleeing. There is one who labours, and struggles, and
hurries, And is so much more behind. Again, there is another that is slow, and needs
help, Lacking skill, and full of poverty; Yet the eye of HWHY looks upon him for good, And raises him up from his humiliation, And lifts his head from misery;
So that many see His peace over all this. Prosperity and adversity, life and death,
Poverty and wealth, come from HWHY. Wisdom, knowledge and understanding of the
Law, are of HWHY; Love, and the way of good works, are from Him. Sin and darkness had their beginning together
with sinners; And evil shall grow old with those who boast in them. The gift of HWHY remains with the righteous,
And His favour brings peace forever. There is he who grows wealthy by his cunning and
frugality, And this is the portion of his reward: For he says, “I have found rest, and now shall eat
continually of my goods.” And yet he does not know what event shall come upon him, And that he must leave those to others, and die. 1129
acquainted with it, And grow old in your work. Do not marvel at the works of sinners;
But trust in HWHY, and continue in your labour; For it is light in the eyes of HWHY to suddenly make a poor man wealthy. The beraḵah of HWHY is in the reward of the
reverent, And suddenly He makes his beraḵah flourish. Do not say, “What profit is there of my service?
And what good shall I have afterward?” Again, do not say, “I have enough, and possess
much, And what evil shall come to me afterward?” In the day of good there is a forgetfulness of
affliction; And in the day of affliction there is no remembrance of good. For it is light for HWHY to reward a man according
to his ways on the day of death. The affliction of an hour makes a man forget
pleasure; And in the end his deeds shall be exposed. Judge none baruḵ before his death;
For a man shall be known in his children. Do not bring every man into your house;
For the deceitful man has many schemes. As a partridge taken in a cage,
So is the heart of the proud; And as a spy, he watches for your fall; For he lies in wait, and turns good into evil,
And in that which is worthy of praise shall accuse you. From a spark of fire a heap of coals is kindled:
And a sinful man lays in wait for blood. 1130
wickedness; Lest he bring upon you an everlasting stain. Receive a stranger into your house, and he shall
disturb you, And turn you out of your own.
When you do good, know to whom you do it; So you shall be thanked for your good works. Do good to the upright, and you shall find a
recompense; And if not from him, even from the Most High. No good shall come to he who is always occupied
with evil, Nor to he who does no kind deed. Give to the upright man, and do not help a sinner.
Do good to he who is lowly, but do not give to the

wicked; Withhold your bread, and do not give it to him, Lest he overthrow you by it; For you shall receive twice as much evil for all the good you have done to him. For the Most High hates sinners, and shall repay
the wicked with retribution, And keeps them for the great day of their punishment. Give to the good, and do not help the sinner.
A friend cannot be known in good times;
And an enemy cannot be hidden in adversity. In the prosperity of a man enemies shall be
grieved: But in his adversity even a friend shall turn away. Never trust your enemy;
For as iron rusts, so is his wickedness. Though he humbles himself, and comes bowed
down, Yet be on your guard and beware of him, 1131

Lest when he has overthrown you, he stands in your place; Neither let him sit at your right hand, Lest he seek to take your seat, and you remember my words in the end, And be pierced by them. Who shall pity a charmer that is bitten by a
serpent, Or any who come near wild beasts? So one that goes to a sinner, and is defiled by him
in his sins, Who shall pity? For a while he shall remain with you,
But if you begin to fall, he shall not wait. An enemy speaks sweetly with his lips,
But in his heart he imagines how to throw you into a pit; He weeps with his eyes, but if he finds opportunity, He shall not be satisfied with blood. If adversity comes upon you, you shall find him
there first; And though he pretends to help you, even so he shall wrong you. He shall shake his head, and clap his hands,
And whisper much, and change his face.
He who handles tar is made unclean by it; And he who has fellowship with a proud man shall be like him. Do not burden yourself above your strength while
you live; And have no fellowship with one who is mightier and wealthier than yourself; 1132
threatens all; The poor is wronged, and he must also plead. If you profit him, he shall use you;
But if you have naught, he shall forsake you. If you possess whatever, he shall live with you;
He shall also leave you naked, and shall not be sorry for it. If he has need of you, he shall deceive you,
And smile at you, and have you in expectancy; He shall speak smooth words to you, and say, “What do you need?” And he shall shame you with his delicacies,

Until he has drained you dry two or three times, And in the end he shall mock you afterward. When he sees you, he shall forsake you, and shake his head at you. Beware that you are not deceived and brought
down in your rejoicing. If you are invited by a mighty man, withdraw
yourself, And he shall invite you so much more. Do not push yourself on him, lest you be turned
away; Do not stand far off, lest you be forgotten. Do not be eager to be equal to him in speech,
And do not believe his many words; For with much talk he shall persuade you, And smiling at you shall draw out your secrets; But cruelly he shall lay up your words, and not
spare to do you harm, And deliver you up. 1133
For you walk in danger of being overthrown; When you hear these, awake from your sleep. Love HWHY all your life,
And call upon Him for your deliverance. Every beast loves its kind,
And every man loves his neighbour. All flesh associates according to kind,
And a man shall cling to those like himself. What fellowship has the wolf with the lamb?
So the sinner with the righteous. What agreement is there between the hyena and
a dog? And what peace between the wealthy and the poor? As the wild donkey is the lion’s prey in the
wilderness; So the wealthy eat up the poor. As the proud hate humility;
So does the wealthy abhor the poor. A wealthy man beginning to fall is supported by
his friends; But a poor man fallen is pushed away by his friends. When a wealthy man is fallen, he has many

helpers; He speaks words not to be spoken, and yet men declare him right: The poor man slips, and yet they also rebuke him; He speaks wisely, but is not heeded. When a wealthy man speaks, every man holds his

tongue, And look, what he says, they exalt it to the clouds; But if the poor man speaks, they say, “What fellow is this?” And if he stumbles, they shall help to overthrow him. Wealth is good to he who has no sin,
And poverty is evil in the mouth of the wicked. 1134
be for good or evil; And a glad heart makes a good face. A good face is a sign of a heart that is good;
And the searching out of parables is a wearisome labour of the mind.
Baruḵ is the man that has not slipped with his mouth, And is not pierced with the great number of sins. Baruḵ is he whose conscience has not
condemned him, And who has not fallen from his expectancy in HWHY. Wealth is not fitting for a miser;
And what should an envious man do with silver? He who gathers by depriving his own being,
Gathers for others that shall spend his goods loosely. He who is evil to himself, to whom shall he be
good? He shall not take pleasure in his goods. There is none worse than he who envies himself;
And this is to repay for his wickedness. And if he does good, he does it unwillingly;
And in the end he shall declare his wickedness. The greedy man has an evil eye;
He turns away his face, and despises men. A covetous man’s eye is not satisfied with his
portion; And the wickedness of the wicked dries up his being. A wicked eye is greedy for bread,
And he is a miser at his table. My son, according to your ability do good to
yourself, And give HWHY His due offering. Remember that death shall not be long in coming,
And that the promise of the grave is not revealed to you. 1135
And according to your ability stretch out your hand and give to him. Do not deprive yourself of a good day,
And do not let the share of a good desire overlook you. Shall you not leave your hardships to another?
And your labours to be divided by lot? Give and take, and qadosh your being;
For there is no seeking delicacies in the grave. All flesh grows old as a garment;
For the promise from the beginning is: You shall die in death. As the green leaves on a thick tree, some fall, and
some grow; So is the generation of flesh and blood: One comes to an end, and another is born. Every work rots and eats away,
And the worker of it shall go likewise. Baruḵ is the man who meditates on goodness in
wisdom,
Shall also have understanding of her secrets. Go after her as one that follows, and lie in wait on
her ways. He who peers in her windows shall also listen at
her doors. He who lodges near her house shall also fasten a
peg on her walls. He shall pitch his tent near to her,
And shall lodge in a lodging where goodness is. He shall put his children under her shelter,
And shall lodge under her branches. By her he shall be covered from heat,
And in her esteem he shall dwell. 1136
He who reveres HWHY shall do good, And he who has the knowledge of the Law shall obtain her. And as a mother she shall meet him,
And receive him as a wife married in maidenhood. With the bread of understanding she shall feed
him, And give him the water of wisdom to drink. He shall be visited by her, and shall not be moved;
And shall rely on her, and shall not be ashamed. She shall exalt him above his neighbours,
And she shall open his mouth in the midst of the assembly. He shall find joy and a crown of gladness,
And she shall cause him to inherit an everlasting name. But foolish men shall not obtain her,
And sinners shall not see her. For she is far from pride,
And men that are liars cannot remember her. Praise is not fitting for the mouth of a sinner,
For it was not sent to him by HWHY. For praise shall be uttered in wisdom,
And HWHY shall make it prosper. Do not say, “It is because of HWHY that I fell away.”
For you ought not to do that which He hates. Do not say, “He has caused me to stray.”
For He has no need of the sinful man. HWHY hates all abomination;
And those who revere Elohim do not love it. He Himself made man from the beginning,
And left him in the hand of his own counsel; So you shall guard the Commands,
And act trustworthily. He has put fire and water before you;
Stretch out your hand to which you choose. 1137
And what he chooses shall be given him. For the wisdom of HWHY is great,
And He is mighty in power, and sees all. And His eyes are upon those who revere Him,
And He knows every work of man. He has commanded no man to do wickedly,
Neither has He given any man permission to sin.
Do not desire a great number of worthless children, Neither delight in wicked sons. Though they increase, do not rejoice in them,
Unless the reverence of HWHY is with them. Do not trust in them living, neither regard their
great number; For one that is righteous is better than a thousand; And it is better to die without children, than to have those who are wicked. For by one that has understanding the city shall
be filled; But the offspring of the wicked shall be quickly laid waste. Many such matters I have seen with my eyes,
And my ear has heard greater than these. In the assembly of the wicked a fire shall be
kindled; And in a rebellious nation wrath is lit on fire. He was not appeased toward the giants of old,
Who fell in the strength of their foolishness. Neither did He spare the place where Lot
sojourned, But loathed them for their pride. He had no compassion for the people of
destruction, Who were taken away in their sins; 1138
Who were gathered together in the hardness of their hearts. And if there is one stiff-necked among the people,
It is marvel if he escapes unpunished; For kindness and wrath are with Him. He is mighty to forgive, and to pour out displeasure. As His kindness is great, so is His discipline also.
And the patience of the righteous shall not be defeated. Make room for every act of kindness;
For everyone shall receive according to his works. HWHY hardened Pharaoh, that he should not know
Him, That His mighty works might be known to the world. His kindness is revealed to every creature;
And He has separated His light from the darkness and is unbreakable. Do not say, “I shall hide myself from HWHY.
“Shall any remember me from above? “I shall not be remembered among so many people; “For what is my being among such a limitless number of creatures?” See, the shamayim, and the shamayim of
shamayim, The deep, and the earth, and all that is in it, Shall be moved at His visitation. The mountains and foundations of the earth shall
also be shaken with trembling, When HWHY looks upon them. No heart may think upon these worthily;
And who is able to perceive His ways? It is a whirlwind that no man sees;
For most of his works are hidden. 1139
righteousness? Or who shall endure them? For His decree is far off, And the trial of all is at the end. He who lacks understanding shall think upon
emptiness; And a foolish man straying plots foolishness. My son, listen to me and learn knowledge,
And know my words in your heart. I shall present instruction by measure,
And declare His knowledge exactly. The works of HWHY are done in right-ruling from
the beginning; And from the time He made them He laid out their parts. He decorated His works forever,
And in His hand are the beginning of them to all generations; They neither labour, nor are weary, nor cease from their works. None of them withholds another,
And they never disobey His word. After this HWHY looked upon the earth,
And filled it with His bireḵoth. Has He covered the face of it with all manner of
living creatures; And they shall return to it again.
HWHY created man from the earth, And returns him to it again. He gave them few days, and a short time,
And also authority over that within it. He gave them strength within themselves,
And made them according to His image, And put the fear of man upon all flesh,
And gave him rule over beasts and birds. 1140
And in the sixth place He gave them understanding, And in the seventh speech, an interpreter of the thoughts. Counsel, and a tongue, and eyes, ears, and a
heart, He gave them to understand. He filled them with the knowledge of
understanding, And showed them good and evil. He put His eye on their hearts,
That He might show them the greatness of His works. He appointed them to boast in His marvellous
deeds forever, That they might declare His works with understanding.
Besides this He gave them knowledge,
And the Law of Ḥai for an inheritance. He made an everlasting Covenant with
them, And gave them His Right-Rulings. Their eyes saw the excellence of His esteem,
And their ears heard His esteemed voice. And He said to them, “Beware of all
unrighteousness.” And He gave every man Command concerning his neighbour. Their ways are ever before Him,
And shall not be hid from His eyes. Every man from his youth is given to evil;
Neither could they make hearts of flesh for themselves from stony. For in the division of the nations of the whole earth
He appointed a ruler over every people; But Yisra’ĕl is the portion of HWHY; 1141
discipline, And giving him the light of His love, does not forsake him. Therefore all their works are as the sun before
Him, And His eyes are continually upon their ways. None of their unrighteous deeds are hid from Him,
But all their sins are before HWHY. But HWHY showing favour and knowing His
workmanship, Neither left nor forsook them, but spared them. The kind deeds of a man are as a signet with Him,
And He shall guard the good deeds of man as the apple of His eye, And give repentance to His sons and daughters. Afterwards He shall rise up and reward them,
And render their recompense upon their heads. And to those who repent, He provides a return,
And comforts those whose expectancy is failing. Return to HWHY, and leave your sins.
Make your prayer before His face, and be guiltless. Turn again to the Most High, and turn away from
wickedness; For He shall lead you out of darkness into the light of peace, And intensely hate your abominations. Who shall praise the Most High in the grave,
Except for those who live and give thanks? Thanksgiving perishes from the dead, as from one
who is not; The living and perfect in heart shall praise HWHY. How great is the kindness of HWHY our Elohim,
And His compassion to those who turn to Him in
For the son of man is not incorruptible. 1142
So flesh and blood shall imagine evil. He views the power of the height of the
shamayim; And all men are but dust and ashes.
He who lives forever has created all in its entirety. HWHY alone is righteous,
And there is no other but He, Who guides the world with the palm of His hand,
And all obey His desire; For He is the Sovereign of all by His power,
works?
excellence? And who also shall tell of His kindnesses? As for the wondrous works of HWHY, there is
naught taken from them, Nor any that are compared to them, Nor may the expanse of them be found out. When a man is finished, then one begins;
And when he leaves, then he shall be uncertain. What is man, and what use is he?
What is his good, and what is his evil? The number of a man’s days at the greatest are a
hundred years. As a drop of water into the sea, and a grain
compared to the sand; So are a thousand years to everlasting days. Therefore Elohim is patient with them,
And pours out His kindness upon them. He looked and saw their end to be evil;
Therefore He multiplied His compassion. 1143
But the kindness of HWHY is upon all flesh. He reproves, and disciplines, and teaches and turns them back again, as a shepherd his flock. He has kindness on those who receive discipline,
And who diligently seek after His Right-Rulings. My son, do not blemish your good deeds,
Nor use harsh words when you give. Does the dew not relieve the heat?
So a word is better than a gift. Look, is a word not better than a gift?
But both are with one showing kindness. A fool shall reproach harshly,
And a gift of the selfish consumes the eyes. Learn before you speak,
And use healing if you are ever sick. Before judgment examine yourself,
And in the day of visitation you shall find kindness. Humble yourself before you become sick,
And in the time of sins show repentance. Let naught hinder you to pay your vow in due
time, And do not delay till death to be declared right. Before you pray, prepare yourself;
And do not be as one that tries HWHY. Think upon the wrath that shall be in the end,
And the time of vengeance, when He turns away His face. When you have enough, remember the time of
hunger: And when you are wealthy, think upon poverty and need. From the morning until the evening the times
change, And all are soon done before HWHY. 1144
And in the day of sinning he shall beware of trespass. But a fool does not observe time. Every man of understanding knows wisdom,
And shall baraḵ he who finds her. Those who have understanding in words also
become wise themselves, And pour forth splendid parables. Do not pursue your lusts,
But restrain yourself from your appetites. If you give your being the desires that it pleases,
It shall make you a mockery to your enemies that slander you. Do not revel in excessive pleasure,
Nor be bound by its expense. Do not become a beggar by feasting through
borrowing, When you have naught in your purse; For you shall be lying in wait for your own life, and be plotted upon.
A labourer that is given to drunkenness shall not be wealthy; And he who despises small matters shall fall little by little. Wine and women shall cause men of
understanding to fall away: And he who clings to whores shall become hardened. Moths and worms shall have him to inherit,
And a bold man shall be taken away. He who is hasty to give credit is light- minded;
And he who sins corrupts his own being. Whoever takes pleasure in wickedness shall be
condemned: But he who resists pleasures crowns his ḥai. He who rules his tongue shall live without strife;
And he who hates gossip shall have less evil. 1145
And you shall not suffer harm. Whether to friend or enemy, do not speak of
another’s life; And if you may without offense, do not reveal them. For if he hears and sees you,
So in time to come he shall hate you. If you have heard a word, let it die with you;
And be brave, it shall not burst you! A fool struggles with a word,
As a woman in labour with a child. As an arrow that sticks in a man’s thigh,
So is a word inside a fool. Admonish a friend, it may be he has not done it;
And if he has done it, that he does it no more. Admonish your friend, it may be he has not said it;
And if he has, that he does not speak it again. Admonish a friend, for many times it is slander,
And do not believe every whisper. There is one that slips in his speech, but not from
his heart; And who is he who has not offended with his tongue? Admonish your neighbour before you threaten
him; And not being wroth, give place to the Law of the Most High. The reverence of HWHY is the beginning of
acceptance, And wisdom obtains His love. The knowledge of the Commands of HWHY is the
instruction of Ḥai: And those who do that which pleases Him, Shall receive the fruit of the tree of immortality. The reverence of HWHY is complete wisdom;
And in all wisdom is the doing of the Law, And the knowledge of His mightiness. 1146
pleases you.” Though afterward he does it, he angers him who feeds him. The knowledge of wickedness is not wisdom,
Nor at any time is insight the counsel of sinners. There is a wickedness, and such is an
abomination; And there is a fool lacking in wisdom. He who has little understanding, and reveres
Elohim, Is better than one that has much wisdom, And transgresses the Law of the Most High. There is a delicate craftiness, and the same is
unrighteous; And there is one that turns aside to make judgment appear; And there is a wise man that speaks rightly in judgment. There is a wicked man that bows his head sadly;
But inwardly he is full of deceit, Casting down his face, and making as if he did not
hear. Where he is unknown, he shall do you evil before you are aware. And if for need of power he may cease
from sinning, Yet when he finds opportunity he shall do evil. A man may be known by his appearance,
And one that has understanding, by his face when you meet him. A man’s dress, and excessive laughter, and walk,
reveal what is.
There is a reproof that is not proper; Again, some man holds his tongue, and he is wise. 1147
secretly; And he who confesses his wrong shall be preserved from harm. How good is it, when you are reproved, to show
repentance! For so you shall escape deliberate sin. As is the lust of a eunuch to defile a maiden;
So is he who executes judgment with violence. There is one that keeps silent, and is found wise;
And another by much babbling becomes hated. Some man holds his tongue, because he has no
answer: And some keep silent, knowing his time. A wise man shall hold his tongue till he sees
opportunity; But a babbler and a fool shall regard no time. He who uses many words shall be loathed;
And he who takes authority for himself in this shall be hated. There is a sinner that has good success in evil;
And there is a gain that turns to loss. There is a gift that shall not profit you;
And there is a gift whose recompense is double. There is he who is shamed because of esteem;
And there he who lifts up his head from a low estate. There is he who buys much for a little,
But repays it sevenfold. A wise man by his words makes him beloved;
But the favours of fools shall be poured out. The gift of a fool shall do you no good when you
have it; Nor that of the greedy by necessity; For he looks to receive much for one. He gives little, and insults greatly;
He opens his mouth as an accuser. 1148
I have no thanks for all my good deeds, And those who eat my bread speak evil of me.” How often, and by how many shall he be mocked!
For he does not know what it is to have; And it is all the same to him as if he did not have. To slip upon a pavement is better than to slip with
the tongue; So shall the fall of the wicked come speedily. An untimely word shall always be in the mouth of
the unwise. A wise word shall be rejected when it comes from
the mouth of a fool; For he shall not speak it in its season. There is he who is hindered from sinning through
poverty; And when he takes rest, he is not troubled. There is he who destroys his own being through
shame, And overthrows himself by showing partiality. There is he who promises to his friend from
shame, And makes him his enemy for naught. A lie is an unclean stain within a man,
Yet it is continually in the mouth of the unlearned. A thief is better than a man who is known to lie:
But they shall both inherit destruction. The way of a liar is humiliation,
And his shame is ever with him. With his words a wise man shall promote himself
to esteem: And he who has understanding shall please great men. 1149
And he who pleases great men shall receive pardon for wrong. Presents and bribes blind the eyes of the wise,
And stop up his mouth so he cannot reprove. Wisdom that is hidden, and treasure that is
hoarded up, What profit is there in either? Better is he who hides his folly
Than a man who hides his wisdom. Enduring patience in seeking HWHY,
Is better than he who leads his life without a guide.
My son, have you sinned? Do so no more, But ask forgiveness for your former sins. Flee from sin as from the face of a serpent;
For if you come too close to it, it shall bite you. The teeth of it are as the teeth of a lion, Slaying the beings of men. All wickedness is as a two-edged sword,
The wounds of which cannot be healed. Fear and wickedness shall waste wealth;
Therefore the house of the proud shall be made desolate. A prayer out of a poor man’s mouth reaches the
ears of Elohim, And his right-ruling comes speedily. He who hates to be reproved is in the path of
sinners; But he who reveres HWHY shall repent from his heart. A learned man is known far and near;
And a man of understanding knows when he slips. He who builds his house with another man’s
silver, Is like one that gathers stones for the tomb of his burial. 1150
together; And their end is a flame of fire to destroy them. The way of sinners is paved with stones,
But at the end of it is the pit of She’ol. He who guards the Law of HWHY gains
understanding from it; And the perfect reverence of HWHY is wisdom. He who is not wise cannot be taught;
But there is a knowledge which multiplies bitterness. The knowledge of a wise man shall increase as a
flood: And his counsel is like a pure fountain of life. The inward parts of a fool are like a broken vessel,
And he shall hold no knowledge as long as he lives. If a skilled man hears a wise word,
He commends it, and adds to it; But when one of no understanding hears it, It displeases him, and he throws it behind his back. The talking of a fool is like a burden on the way;
But favour shall be found in the lips of the wise. They inquire at the mouth of the wise in the
assembly, And they shall consider his words in their heart. As is a house that is destroyed, so is wisdom to a
fool; And the knowledge of the unwise are words without sense. Instruction to fools is as chains on the feet,
And like shackles on the right hand. A fool lifts up his voice with laughter;
But a wise man hardly smiles a little. Learning is to a wise man as an ornament of gold,
And like a bracelet upon his right arm. The foot of a fool hurries into his house;
But a diligent man is ashamed of him. 1151
But he who is disciplined shall stand outside. It is the disrespect of a man to listen at the door:
But a wise man shall be grieved with the shame. The lips of gossipers speak that which does not
pertain to them; But the words of those who have understanding are weighed in the balance. The heart of fools is in their mouth;
But the mouth of the wise is in their heart. When the wicked curses an adversary,
He curses his own being. A whisperer defiles his own being, and is hated
wherever he dwells.
A lazy man is compared to a filthy stone, And all shall hiss him to shame. An idle man is compared to the filth of a dunghill:
Every man that picks it up shall shake off his hand. An undisciplined man is the shame of his father
that brought him forth; And a daughter is brought forth to his loss. A wise daughter brings an inheritance to her
husband; But she who lives dishonestly is her father’s heaviness. She who is bold shames both her father and her
husband, And they shall both despise her. An untimely word is music in mourning;
But blows and discipline by wisdom are never untimely. Whoever teaches a fool is as one who glues a
potsherd together, And as he who wakes one from a sound sleep. He who speaks a word to a fool speaks to one in a
slumber; 1152
They shall cover the lowliness of their parents. But children, being haughty, through pride and
lacking discipline, Stain the nobility of their relatives. Weep for the dead, for he has lost the light;
And weep for the fool, for he lacks understanding. Make little weeping for the dead, for he is at rest: But the life of the fool is worse than death. Seven days men shall mourn for the dead;
But all the days of his life for a fool and a wicked man. Do not speak much with a fool,

And do not go to he who has no understanding. Beware of him, lest you have trouble, And you shall never be defiled with his foolishness. Depart from him, and you shall find rest, And never be worried with madness. What is heavier than lead?
And what is its name, but a fool? Sand, and salt, and a mass of iron, is easier to
bear, Than a man without understanding. As timber girded and bound together in a building
cannot be loosed with shaking; So the heart that is established by wise counsel shall fear at no time. A heart rested upon a thought of understanding,
Is as a lovely plastering on the wall of a gallery. Fences put on a high place shall never stand
against the wind; So a fearful heart in the mind of a fool cannot stand against any fear. 1153
And he who pricks the heart makes it show her knowledge. Whoever throws a stone at the birds frightens
them away; And he who reproaches his friend breaks a friendship. Though you draw a sword against your friend, yet
do not despair; For there may be a returning. If you have opened your mouth against your

friend, Do not fear; For there may be an atonement, Except for reproach, or pride, or disclosing secrets, or a deadly wound; For these matters every friend shall depart. Be trustworthy to your neighbour in his poverty,

That you may rejoice in his prosperity. Remain steadfast with him in the time of his distress, That you may be heir with him in his inheritance; For a poor position is not always to be despised; Nor the wealthy, who are foolish to be held in admiration. As the clouds and smoke of a furnace goes before
the fire; So reviling before blood. I shall not be ashamed to defend a friend;
Nor shall I hide myself from him. But if any evil comes upon me because of him,
Every one that hears it shall beware of him. Who shall appoint a guard before my mouth,
And a seal of wisdom upon my lips, So I do not suddenly fall by them, And that my tongue does not destroy me? 1154
O HWHY, Father and Aḏon of all my ḥai, Do not leave me to their counsels, And do not let me fall by them. Who shall appoint whips over my thoughts,
And the discipline of wisdom over my heart? That they do not spare me for my ignorances, And it does not pass by my sins; Lest my ignorances increase, and my sins multiply
to my destruction, And I fall before my adversaries, and my enemy rejoice over me, Whose expectancy is far from Your kindness. O HWHY, Father and Elohim of my ḥai,
Do not give me a proud look, But always turn your servants away from a haughty mind. Turn me away from worthless expectation and
lust, And You hold up he who desires to always serve You. Do not let the gluttony of the stomach nor lust of
the flesh take hold of me; And do not give me, your servant, over to a hardened heart. Hear O you children, the instruction of the mouth;
He who guards it shall never be overtaken with his lips. The sinner shall be left in his foolishness;
Both the speaker of evil and the proud shall fall by it. Do not accustom your mouth to swearing;
Nor use the Name of the Qadosh One. For as a servant that is continually beaten shall
not be without a bruise; So he who swears Naming Elohim continually shall not be guiltless. 1155

And the plague shall never depart from his house. If he transgresses, his sin shall be upon him; And if he does not acknowledge his sin, he commits a double offense: And if he swears in vain, he shall not be innocent, But his house shall be filled with calamities. There is a word that is clothed with death;
Elohim grant that it not be found in the inheritance of Ya’aqoḇ; For all such matters shall be far from the reverent, And they shall not wallow In their sins. Do not use your mouth to swear rashly,
For in these words there is sin. Remember your father and your mother when you

sit among great men. Do not be forgetful before them, and so, by your habit, Become a fool, and wish that you had not been born, And curse the day of your birth. The man who is accustomed to insulting words
Shall never be instructed all the days of his life. Two kinds of men multiply sin, and the third shall

bring wrath: A heated spirit as a burning fire shall never be quenched till it is consumed: One who whores in the body of his flesh shall never cease till he has kindled a fire. All bread is sweet to those who whore,
He does not cease till he dies. An adulterer, says thus in his heart:
“Who sees me? I am surrounded with darkness. “The walls cover me, and no one sees me; what do I need to fear? “The Most High shall not remember my sins.” Such a man only fears the eyes of men,
And does not know that the eyes of HWHY are ten 1156
So after they were accomplished he looked upon them all. This man shall be punished in the streets of the
city, And he shall be taken where he does not suspect. So it shall also be for the wife that leaves her
husband, And brings forth an heir by another. For firstly, she has disobeyed the Law of the Most

High; And secondly, she has trespassed against her own husband; And thirdly, she has committed whoring by adultery, And brought forth children by another man. She shall be brought out into the assembly,
And inquiry shall be made of her children. Her children shall not take root,
And her branches shall not bring forth fruit. She shall leave a cursed remembrance,
And her reproach shall not be blotted out. And those who remain shall know that there is
none better than the reverence of HWHY, And that there is naught sweeter than to guard the Commands of HWHY. It is great esteem to follow HWHY,
And to be accepted by Him is long life.
Wisdom shall praise herself, And be esteemed in the midst of her people. In the assembly of the Most High she opens her
mouth, And overcomes before His power. 1157
And covered the earth as a cloud. I dwelt in high places,
And my throne is in a cloudy pillar. I alone surrounded the circuit of the shamayim,
And walked in the bottom of the deep. In the waves of the sea and in all the earth,
And in every people and nation, I obtained a possession. With all these I sought rest;
And in whose inheritance shall I remain? So the Creator of all gave me a command,
And He who made me gave rest for my tent, and said, “Let your dwelling be in Ya’aqoḇ, and your inheritance in Yisra’ĕl.” He created me from the beginning before the
world, And I shall never fail.
And so I was established in Tsiyon. Likewise in the beloved city He gave me rest,
And in Yerushalayim was my strength. And I took root in an esteemed people,
Even in the portion of the inheritance of HWHY. I was exalted like a cedar in Leḇanon,
And as a cypress upon the mountains of Ḥermon. I was exalted like a palm tree in Ĕyn Geḏi,
And as a rosebush in Yeriḥo, As a fair olive tree in a pleasant field, And grew as a fig tree by the water. I gave a sweet smell like cinnamon and rosewood,
And I yielded a pleasant fragrance like the best myrrh, As galbanam, and shoham, and fragrant gum, And as the fragrance of frankincense in the Mishkan. 1158
And my branches are the branches of esteem and favour. As the vine I brought forth a pleasant fragrance,
And my flowers are the fruit of esteem and wealth. I am the mother of pleasant love, and reverence,
And fill yourselves with my fruit. For my remembrance is sweeter than honey,
And my inheritance than the honeycomb. Those who eat of me shall hunger for more,
And those who drink me shall thirst for more. He who obeys me shall never be ashamed,
And those who work beside me shall not do wrong. All these are the Book of the Covenant of the Most
High Elohim, Even the Law which Mosheh Commanded for an inheritance to the congregations of Ya’aqoḇ. Do not lose heart, but be strong in HWHY, that He
may confirm you; Cling to Him, for HWHY Almighty is Elohim alone, And beside Him there is no other Saviour. He fills all with His wisdom,
As Pishon and as Ḥiddeqel in the time of first- fruits. He makes understanding to abound like Perath,
And as the Yardĕn in the time of the harvest. He makes the instruction of knowledge appear as
the light, And as Giḥon in the time of grape harvest. The first man did not know her fully;
Nor shall the last find her out. For her thoughts are more than the sea,
And her counsels deeper than the great deep. 1159
And as a channel into a garden. I said, “I shall water my best garden,
And shall water my garden bed very much.” And see, my wadi became a river, and my river became a sea. I shall yet make instruction to shine as the
morning, And shall send forth her light far away. I shall yet pour out instruction as neḇuah,
And leave it to all ages forever. See that I have not laboured for myself only,
But for all those who seek wisdom.

In three matters I was adorned, And stood in loveliness both before Elohim and man: The oneness of brothers, the love of neighbours, A man and wife that agree together. Three sorts of men my being hates,
And I greatly loathe of their life: A poor man who is proud, a wealthy man who is a liar, And an old adulterer who is foolish. If you have gathered naught in your youth,
How shall you find any matter in your old age? O how lovely is judgment for grey hairs,
And for the aged to know counsel! O how lovely is the wisdom of old men,
And understanding and counsel in men of esteem. Much experience is the crown of old men,
And the reverence of Elohim is their esteem. There are nine which I have judged in my heart to
be baruḵ, And the tenth I shall relate with my tongue: A man that has joy from his children; And he who lives to see the fall of his enemy. 1160
understanding, And that has not slipped with his tongue, And that has not served a man more unworthy than himself. Good is he who has found insight,
And he who speaks in the ears of those who listen. O how great is he who finds wisdom!
Yet there is none above he who reveres HWHY. But the love of HWHY passes all in understanding;
He who possesses it, to what shall he be likened? The reverence of HWHY is the beginning of His
love; And belief is the beginning of clinging to Him. Any wound, but a wound of the heart;
And any wickedness, but the wickedness of a woman. And any affliction, but the affliction from those who
hate me; And any revenge, but the revenge of enemies. There is no venom above the venom of a serpent;
And there is no wrath above the wrath of an enemy. I would rather dwell with a lion and a dragon,
Than to dwell in a house with a wicked woman. The wickedness of a woman changes her
appearance, And darkens her face like sackcloth. Her husband shall sit among his neighbours;
And listening he shall sigh bitterly. All wickedness is but little to the wickedness of a
woman; Let the portion of a sinner fall upon her. As the climbing of a sandy way is to the feet of the
aged, So is a wife full of words to a quiet man. 1161
And do not desire her for pleasure. A woman supporting her husband,
Is full of wrath, hardness, and much reproach. A wicked woman causes courage to cease,
Causes a heavy face and a wounded heart; A woman that does not comfort her husband in distress Causes weak hands and feeble knees. From the woman came the beginning of sin,
And because of her we all die. Give water no outlet;
Nor a wicked woman freedom to roam. If she does not do as you would have her,
Cut her off from yourself, And give her a certificate of divorce, and let her go.
Baruḵ is the man that has a capable wife, For the number of his days shall be double. A capable woman gladdens her husband,
And he shall fill the years of his life in peace. A good wife is a good portion,
Which shall be given in the portion of those who revere HWHY. Whether a man is wealthy or poor,
If he has a good heart toward HWHY, He shall rejoice at all times with a cheerful face. There are three matters that my heart fears;

And of the fourth I was very afraid: The slander of a city, the gathering together of an unruly crowd, and a false accusation; All these are worse than death. But a woman that is jealous over another woman
is grieving to the heart and sorrow; And a lashing tongue which makes known to all. 1162
He who has hold of her is as though he held a scorpion. A drunken and wandering woman causes great
wrath, And she does not cover her own shame. The whoring of a woman is known by her haughty
looks and eyelids. If your daughter is wayward, keep her straight,
Lest she abuse herself through too much freedom. Watch over one with a hard eye;
And do not marvel if she trespasses against you. She shall open her mouth, as a thirsty traveller
who has found a fountain, And drink of every water near her. By every hedge she shall sit down, And open her quiver for every arrow. The favour of a wife delights her husband,
And her discretion shall fatten his bones. A silent and loving woman is a gift of HWHY;
And there is naught worth as much as a mind well instructed. A humble and trustworthy woman is a double
favour, And her sober mind cannot be valued. As the sun when it rises high in the shamayim;
So is the loveliness of a good wife in the ordering of her house.
So is the loveliness of the face in ripe age. As the golden stands upon the sockets of silver;
So are the lovely feet with a constant heart. My son, guard the flower of your youth well;
And do not give your strength to foreigners. When you have acquired a fruitful possession
through all the field, 1163
Having the confidence of their good genealogy. A whore shall be counted as spittle;
But a married woman is a tower against death to her husband. A wicked woman is given as a portion to a wicked
man; But a reverent woman is given to he who reveres HWHY. A dishonest woman is despised and shamed;
But an honest woman shall revere her husband. A headstrong woman shall be counted as a dog;
But she that is humble reveres HWHY. A woman that esteems her husband shall be
judged wise among all; But she that shames him in her pride shall be counted wicked among all. A loud-mouthed woman and a nagger shall be
sought out to drive away the enemies. There are two matters that grieve my heart;

And the third makes me wroth: A man of battle that suffers poverty; And men of understanding that are not respected; And one that turns from righteousness to sin; HWHY prepares such a one for the sword. A merchant hardly guards himself from doing
wrong; And a trader is not free from sin.
Many have sinned for a small matter; And he who seeks abundance turns his eyes away. As a nail holds fast between the join of stones;
So sin holds close between buying and selling. 1164
of HWHY, His house shall soon be overthrown. As when one sifts with a sieve, the refuse
remains; So the filth of man is in his words. The furnace tries the potter’s vessels;
So the trial of man is in his reasoning. The fruit declares if the tree has been cultivated;
So is the speaking of pride in the heart of man. Praise no man before you hear him speak;
For this is the trial of men. If you follow righteousness, you shall obtain it,
And put it on, as a long robe of esteem. The birds shall gather with their kind;
So does sin for those who work wickedness. The words of a reverent man are always with
wisdom; But a fool changes as the moon. Watch the time if you are among the foolish;
But be continually among men of understanding. The words of fools are troublesome,
And their entertainment is the indecency of sin. The words of he who swears much makes the hair
stand upright; And their uproar makes one stop his ears. The strife of the proud is bloodshed,
And their revilings are grievous to the ear. Whoever uncovers secrets loses his trust;
And shall never find a friend of his being. Love your friend, and be trustworthy to him;
But if you betray his secrets, never again follow after him. For as a man has destroyed his enemy;
So you have lost the love of your neighbour. 1165
So you have let your neighbour go, And shall not have him again. Do not follow after him, for he is too far off;
He is like a gazelle escaped out of the snare. As for a wound, it may be bound up,
And after reviling there may be peace; But he who betrays secrets is without expectancy. He who winks with the eyes works evil;
And he who knows him departs from him. When you are present, he shall speak sweetly,
and shall admire your words; But in the end he shall twist his mouth, and slander your sayings. I have hated many matters, but naught like him;
For HWHY shall hate him. Whoever throws a stone high, throws it on his own
head; And a blow in deceit makes wounds. Whoever digs a pit shall fall in to it;
And he who lays a trap shall be caught in it. He who does evil, it shall fall upon him,
And he shall not know from where it comes. Mockery and reproach are from the proud;
But vengeance as a lion, lies in wait for them. Those who rejoice at the fall of the righteous shall
be taken in the snare; And anguish shall consume them before they die. Evil and wrath, even these are abominations;
And the sinful man has them both.
He who is vengeful shall find vengeance from HWHY, And He shall surely keep account of his sins. Forgive your neighbour the harm that he has done
to you, So your sins shall also be forgiven when you pray. 1166
And should he seek forgiveness from HWHY? He shows no kindness to a man, who is like
himself; And does he ask forgiveness of his own sins? If he who is but flesh maintains hatred,
Who shall pray forgiveness for his sins? Remember your end, and let enmity cease;
Corruption and death, and remain in the Commands. Remember the Commands, and bear no evil
against your neighbour; The Covenant of the Most High, and overlook faults. Abstain from strife, and you shall diminish your
sins; For a man of rage kindles strife, A sinful man disrupts friendships,
And creates quarrels among those who are at peace. As the structure of the fire, so it burns:
And as a man’s strength is, so is his wrath; And according to his wealth his wrath rises; And the stronger they are who contend, The more they shall be inflamed. A hasty quarrel kindles a fire;
And hasty fighting sheds blood. If you blow the spark, it shall burn;
If you spit upon it, it shall be quenched; And both of these come out of your mouth. Curse the gossiper and double tongued;
For such have destroyed many who were at peace. A backbiting tongue has troubled many, and
driven them from nation to nation: It has pulled down strong cities, and overthrown the houses of great men. A backbiting tongue has thrown out virtuous
women, And deprived them of their labours. 1167
never dwell quietly.
But the stroke of the tongue breaks the bones. Many have fallen by the edge of the sword;
But not as many who have fallen by the tongue. It is good for he who is protected from its venom;
Who has not drawn its yoke, nor been bound in its bands. For its yoke is a yoke of iron,
And its bands are bands of bronze. The death from it is an evil death;
The grave is better than it. It shall not rule over those who revere Elohim,
Nor shall they be burned with its flame. Those who forsake HWHY shall fall into it;
And it shall burn in them, and not be quenched. It shall be sent upon them as a lion, And devour them as a leopard. As you hedge your possessions with thorns
around, And bind up your silver and gold, Weigh your words in a balance,
And make a door and bar for your mouth. Beware you do not slip by it,
Lest you fall before he who lies in wait.
He who is kind shall lend to his neighbour; And he who strengthens his hand guards the Commands. Lend to your neighbour in his time of need,
And repay your neighbour again in due season. Guard your word, and deal trustworthily with him,
And you shall always find that which is necessary for you. 1168
found, And put to trouble those who helped them. Till he has received, he shall kiss a man’s hand;

And for his neighbour’s silver he shall speak softly; But when he should repay, he shall prolong the time, And return words of grief, and complain of the time. If he overcomes, he shall hardly give the half,

And he shall count it as though he had found it. If not, he has deprived him of his silver, and he has gained an enemy without cause. He pays him with cursings and slander; And instead of esteem he shall pay him shame. Many have therefore refused to lend for other
men’s evil deeds, Fearing to be cheated. Yet have patience with a man in poverty,
And do not delay to show him kindness. Help the poor for the sake of the Command,
And do not turn him away because of his poverty. Lose your silver for your brother and your friend,
And do not let it rust under a stone to be lost. Lay up your treasure according to the Commands
of the Most High, And it shall bring you more profit than gold. Store up kind deeds in your storehouses,
And it shall deliver you from all affliction. It shall fight for you against your enemies better
than a mighty shield and strong spear. An honest man stands guarantor for his
neighbour; But he who is impudent shall forsake him. Do not forgot the friendship of your guarantor,
For he has given his life for you. A sinner shall overthrow the good manner of his
guarantor; 1169
delivered him. Guarantee has undone many of good estate,
And shaken them as a wave of the sea. It has driven mighty men from their houses, So that they wandered among foreign nations. A wicked man transgressing the Commands of
HWHY shall fall in guarantee; And he who undertakes and follows other men’s business for gain shall fall into lawsuits. Assist your neighbour according to your ability,
And beware that you do not fall into the same. The necessities for life are water, and bread, and
garments, And a house for privacy. Better is the life of a poor man in a lowly cottage,
Than food of delicacies in another man’s house. Whether little or much, be content,
That you do not hear the reproach of your house. For it is a miserable life to go from house to
house; For where you are a stranger, you dare not open your mouth. You shall entertain, and feast, and have no
thanks; And you shall hear bitter words: “Come, you stranger, and furnish a table,
And feed me of what you have ready. “Give place, you stranger, to an esteemed man;
My brother seeks lodging, and I have need of my house.” These matters are grievous to a man of
understanding; The contempt of a household, and a reproach of the lender. 1170
He who loves his son causes him to often feel the rod, That he may have joy from him in the end. He who punishes his son shall have joy in him,
And shall rejoice in him among his acquaintances. He who teaches his son grieves the enemy;
And before his friends he shall rejoice in him. Though his father dies, it is as though he were not
dead; For he has left one behind who is like himself. While he lived, he saw and rejoiced in him:
And when he died, he was not grieved. He left behind an avenger against his enemies,
And one that shall repay kindness to his friends. He who makes too much of his son binds up his
wounds; And his body shall be troubled at every cry. A horse unbroken becomes headstrong:
And a child left to himself shall be unruly. Spoil your child, and he shall cause you dread;
Play with him, and he shall bring you to grief. Do not laugh with him, lest you have sorrow from
him, And lest you gnash your teeth in the end. Give him no freedom in his youth,
And do not wink at his foolishness. Bow down his neck while he is young,
And beat his side while he is a child, Lest he become stubborn, and be disobedient to you, And so bring sorrow to your heart. Discipline your son, and put him to work,
Lest his wicked behaviour be a stumbling to you. Better is the poor, being healthy and strong in
body, Than a wealthy man who is afflicted in his body. 1171
gold, And a strong body above infinite wealth. There is no wealth above a healthy body,
And no joy above the joy of the heart. Death is better than a bitter life or continual
sickness. Delicacies poured upon a closed mouth,
Are as servings of meat placed upon a grave. What good is the offering to an idol?
For it neither eats nor smells; So is he who is persecuted by HWHY. He sees with his eyes and groans,
As a eunuch that embraces a maiden and sighs. Do not give your mind over to sorrow,
And do not afflict yourself on purpose. The gladness of the heart is the life of man,
And the joy of a man prolongs his days. Love your own being, and comfort your heart.
Remove sorrow far from you; For sorrow has killed many, and there is no profit in it. Envy and wrath shorten the life,
And worry brings age before time. A cheerful and good heart pays attention to his
meat and diet.
Watching for wealth consumes the flesh, And the worry of it drives away sleep. Watchful worry does not let a man slumber,
As a painful disease breaks sleep. The wealthy labours greatly in gathering wealth
together; And when he rests, he is filled with his delicacies. The poor labours in his poverty;
And when he finishes, he is still needy. He who loves gold shall not be declared right,
And he who pursues corruption shall have enough. 1172
And their destruction stands. It is a stumbling block to those who offer to it,
And every fool shall be taken in it. Baruḵ is the wealthy who is found without blemish,
And has not gone after gold. Who is he, that we may call him baruḵ?
For he has done wonders among his people. Who has been tried by it, and found perfect?
